docs.lead_paragraph: Shoni and Jude Schimmel, who belong to the Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla in eastern Oregon, have become indispensable members of the Louisville Cardinals.

headline.seo: Final Four — For Louisville, American Indian Sisters Inspire
headline.main: Far From Reservation, Sisters Lead Louisville
headline.print_headline: Far From Reservation, Sisters Lead Louisville

docs.abstract: Profiles of Louisville women's basketball teammates and sisters Shoni and Jude Schimmel, who belong to the Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla in eastern Oregon; Schimmel sisters have become indispensable members of the Louisville's team, which is preparing to face California at the Final Four in New Orleans.
docs.snippet: Shoni and Jude Schimmel, who belong to the Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla in eastern Oregon, have become indispensable members of the Louisville Cardinals.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge’s ruling on the emergency contraceptive pill is a fitting rebuke to a politically motivated decision.

headline.seo: Good Sense on the Morning-After Pill
headline.main: Good Sense on the Morning-After Pill
headline.print_headline: Good Sense on the Morning-After Pill

docs.abstract: Editorial praises Federal Judge Edward Korman for overturning Obama administration's ban preventing girls younger than 17 from purchasing emergency contraceptive pills over the counter; holds ruling is well-deserved rebuke to politically motivated decision.
docs.snippet: A federal judge’s ruling on the emergency contraceptive pill is a fitting rebuke to a politically motivated decision.

docs.lead_paragraph: An acidly worded decision raised a broader question about whether a cabinet secretary can decide on a drug’s availability for reasons other than its safety and effectiveness.

headline.seo: Judge Orders F.D.A. to Make Morning-After Pill Available Over the Counter for All Ages
headline.main: Judge Strikes Down Age Limits on Morning-After Pill
headline.print_headline: Judge Overturns Age Limit To Buy A Contraceptive

docs.abstract: Federal Judge Edward R Korman orders that Plan B morning-after pill be made available over the counter for all ages, instead of requiring prescription for girls 16 and younger; hotly-worded decision accuses Obama administration and Health and Human Services secretary Kathleen Sebelius of political motivation when they restricted sale of drug in 2011.
docs.snippet: An acidly worded decision raised a broader question about whether a cabinet secretary can decide on a drug’s availability for reasons other than its safety and effectiveness.

byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear and Sabrina Tavernise contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: The harrowing assault stunned many in Brazil, especially as Rio de Janeiro tries to promote itself as a city on the mend and prepares to host the 2014 World Cup and 2016 Olympic Games.

headline.seo: American Woman Gang-Raped on Transit Van in Rio de Janeiro
headline.main: American Woman Gang-Raped and Beaten on Brazilian Transit Van
headline.print_headline: American Woman Gang-Raped and Beaten on Brazilian Transit Van

docs.abstract: Brazilian police say American woman was raped by three men aboard public van in six-hour abduction that began in seaside district of Copacabana; assault stuns many in Brazil, especially as Rio de Janeiro tries to promote itself as city on mend and prepares to host 2014 World Cup and 2016 Olympics.
docs.snippet: The harrowing assault stunned many in Brazil, especially as Rio de Janeiro tries to promote itself as a city on the mend and prepares to host the 2014 World Cup and 2016 Olympic Games.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and TAYLOR BARNES

headline.main: Outlawing Abortion Won't Help Children with Down Syndrome

docs.abstract: Some parents are celebrating the news that North Dakota has become the first state to outlaw abortion for fetal conditions like Down syndrome. I’m not.
